discussion.content: Security group Operates at the instance level, while Network ACL Operates at the subnet level.

Selected Answer: B
Security groups

Selected Answer: B
Security groups in AWS act as an instance-level firewall to control inbound and outbound access to Amazon EC2 instances. They operate at the instance level and are associated with a specific instance or group of instances. Security groups allow you to define rules that specify the allowed inbound and outbound traffic based on protocols, ports, and IP addresses. They provide a stateful firewall, meaning that they track the state of a connection and automatically allow the return traffic for established connections.

Amazon Redshift is a fully managed data warehousing service that is designed for online analytic processing (OLAP). It is optimized for high-performance analysis and supports standard SQL queries.

questions.question_text:
A company needs a data warehouse for analytical workloads. The data warehouse must support standard SQL queries.

Which AWS service meets these requirements?

A company wants guidance to optimize the cost and performance of its current AWS environment.

Which AWS service or tool should the company use to identify areas for optimization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS TrustedAdvisor

"AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations that help you follow AWS best practices. Trusted Advisor evaluates your account by using checks. These checks identify ways to optimize your AWS infrastructure, improve security and performance, reduce costs, and monitor service quotas. You can then follow the recommendations to optimize your services and resources."

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awssupport/latest/user/compute-optimizer-with-trusted-advisor.html

Selected Answer: B
AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations that help you follow AWS best practices. Trusted Advisor evaluates your account by using checks. These checks identify ways to optimize your AWS infrastructure, improve security and performance, reduce costs, and monitor service quotas. You can then follow the recommendations to optimize your services and resources

Selected Answer: C
C. Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.

"With MFA, users have a device that generates a response to an authentication challenge. Each user's credentials and device-generated response are required to complete the sign-in process. "

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html#enable-mfa-for-privileged-users:~:text=With%20MFA%2C%20users%20have%20a%20device%20that%20generates%20a%20response%20to%20an%20authentication%20challenge.%20Each%20user%27s%20credentials%20and%20device%2Dgenerated%20response%20are%20required%20to%20complete%20the%20sign%2Din%20process

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html
Answer: C

Selected Answer: C
The recommendation that complies with IAM security best practices is:

C. Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.

Enabling MFA adds an extra layer of security to the IAM user accounts by requiring an additional authentication factor, such as a unique code from a mobile device, in addition to the regular username and password. This helps protect against unauthorized access even if the username and password are compromised.

questions.question_text:
A company is setting up AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) on an AWS account.

Which recommendation complies with IAM security best practices?

choices.D: Avoid rotating credentials to prevent issues in production applications.
choices.B: Grant broad permissions so that all company employees can access the resources they need.
choices.A: Use the account root user access keys for administrative tasks.
choices.C: Turn on multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security during the login process.
